intro: Phlomis × stapfiana, commonly known as the hybrid everlasting phlomis, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of the Middle East and Central Asia. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic plants known for their medicinal and culinary uses. The plant is characterized by its tall, upright stems and clusters of blue to purple flowers that bloom in summer. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its drought-resistant nature. Phlomis × stapfiana is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in rocky or well-drained soils.
